Description: Nile silt pottery beaker, exterior coated with red slip with black top and burnished; flat base, slightly flaring sides and out-turning rim. Incised post-firing with a representation of a hippopotamus on one side.
Curator's comments: Potmark illustrated in W.M.F Petrie and A.C. Mace, Diospolis Parva, London (1901), pl. xx.26. Black top red ware B22a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
